intro: Hippomarathrum caspicum, commonly known as the Caspian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus and parts of Central Asia. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by spherical, fleshy fruits. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
